body: I made an app for this here https://issues.streamlit.app/?issue=gh-11722, but haven't been able to reproduce it yet on Android 16 chrome, firefox. So maybe limited to older versions of Android OS.

Please use Brave Browser in Android....

@MaverickAlonso can you confirm whether you are only seeing the issue using the Brave browser, or does it appear also in Chrome? The earlier description mentions Chrome.

Thanks Laura for your quick response.

Apologies for the confusion â€” after further testing, I can confirm that
this issue only occurs in the **Brave browser, tested on Android**.

The `st.chat_input()` component works correctly in:
- Chrome (Android)
- Safari (iOS)
- Desktop browsers (Chrome, Firefox)

Only Brave (Android) fails to render the input bar in Streamlit 1.46.0.
Thanks for your attention, and let me know if I can help further!

El lun, 23 jun 2025 a las 9:48, Laura Wilby ***@***.***>)

Just FYI, I tested this on Brave on a Pixel 9 and did not have an issue.
Thanks for testing @sfc-gh-dmatthews . @MaverickAlonso which Android OS version are you using, 12? I wonder if this is only an issue with older OS versions.

Hi, I'm using Android version 15 and One UI 7.0

Hi All.  Let me clarify the bug more clearly. One thing I forgot to mention earlier is that the test includes the use of st.pills. I just ran a new test, and the issue persists. I'm attaching the following for reference:

- A test using *Brave* and st.pills with a previous version of Streamlit,  where everything works correctly.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/edfd901a-042a-496e-bd00-26e3cb4dc9b3)

- A test using version 1.46, where the issue appears.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ef25e48-5700-4280-b571-78c8dc1ab544)

This is the code for testing:
import streamlit as st

st.title("Chat Test")
st.write("Try asking something below:")

# Quick options for the user
options = ["What's your name?", "What can you do?", "Tell me something fun",
"Help"]

# Display the pills with a title
selected_pill = st.pills("Quick questions", options, key="selected_pill")

# Show the selected pill
if selected_pill:
    st.write(f"You selected: {selected_pill}")

# Chat input
user_input = st.chat_input("Type your question here")

# Show the input from chat
if user_input:
    st.write(f"You asked: {user_input}")

BR,
M
